title: Looks For Books
description: This is a full stack book review application that manages a secure login, form validation, basic search, and allows you to leave your own reviews and ratings, while also checking the Good Reads API for additional rating data.

title: Hope Is Rising
description: This was my first client project. One of the joys of software development is getting to contribute meaningful work to organizations I believe in.
highlightDescription: Working with Ryan is a client's dream. He used his knowledge and attached it to our dream to make that dream come true. The site he built for us was flawless. Anything we asked for, he made happen. Working with him was like having another team member catch the vision and run with it!

title: Soprano Portfolio
description: A portfolio for a profession soprano showcasing her work and providing a simple method for posting new content and events. Gatsby allows pages to be automatically generated with excellent page loading performance.
highlightDescription: Ryan is so easy to work with! I provided him with my vision and some set needs, but otherwise, left the rest up to him. His combination of artistic creativity and technical prowess produced a beautiful website. Ryan manages to support and expand upon ideas to deliver a professional product. He is incredibly responsive and a pleasure to work with!

title: Rock Paper Scissors
description: A game against the computer practicing JavaScript animations. It was good UX Design practice, making sure the game was intuitive to play.

title: Calculator
description: This calculator app was a project for The Odin Project course. It was an opportunity to practice adding event listeners, practice css formatting, and put more advanced logic into an application.

title: Google
description: A basic intro project for every beginner, I really enjoyed figuring out how to go the extra step and add in the animated "I'm feeling Lucky" button even though I didn't really know JavaScript at the time.

title: Etch-A-Sketch
description: This Etch-A-Sketch was a project for The Odin Project course. It was an opportunity to practice adding event listeners, and put more advanced logic into an application.
